section.section: The holder of a contractor license that is on inactive status may not act as a contractor in the State.
The holder of a subcontractor license that is on inactive status may not act as a subcontractor in the State.
The holder of a salesperson license that is on inactive status may not sell a home improvement in the State.
The holder of a contractor license that is on inactive status is not required to meet the liability insurance requirement of § 8-302.1 of this subtitle.
The holder of a contractor license that is on inactive status is not subject to an assessment for the Fund under § 8-404(b) of this title.

text.section: The placement of a license on inactive status does not affect the power of the Commission to suspend or revoke the license or to take any other disciplinary action against the licensee.

section.section: A licensee whose license is on inactive status remains responsible for renewing the license as required under § 8-308 of this subtitle.
The holder of a contractor license that is on inactive status may renew the license without complying with the liability insurance requirement of § 8-302.1 of this subtitle.

Notwithstanding § 8-308 of this subtitle, a licensee whose license is on inactive status shall pay to the Commission a renewal fee of:
$112.50 for a contractor license;
$62.50 for a subcontractor license; or
$37.50 for a salesperson license.

text.section:
The Commission shall reactivate the license of a licensee that is on inactive status and reissue the license to the licensee, if the licensee:
submits to the Commission an application for reactivation on the form that the Commission provides;
pays to the Commission a reissuance fee of $10; and
meets the requirements for a license, including, in the case of a contractor, the liability insurance requirement under § 8-302.1 of this subtitle.
